thread.title: I Shop for a Living, and These 16 Style and Home Finds Were the Best I Tested in 2023
thread.title_full: I Shop for a Living, and These 16 Style and Home Finds Were the Best I Tested in 2023

author: yahoo
title: I Shop for a Living, and These 16 Style and Home Finds Were the Best I Tested in 2023
text:
Shopping I Tested 250+ Products This Year, and These Were My 16 Favorites in 2023 Ahem, you’re welcome.
By Wendy Vazquez Wendy Vazquez Wendy is a home commerce writer covering trends, news, and deals for Real Simple, Better Homes & Gardens, and Southern Living. Real Simple's Editorial Guidelines Published on December 28, 2023 03:00PM EST We independently evaluate all recommended products and services. If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation. Learn more .
Photo: Real Simple / Tyler Roeland
2023 was quite a year for unforgettable launches that thrilled me and served me well. After testing over 250 fashion, beauty, and home products this year, there were a handful that stood out to me.
As a shopping writer, plenty of items make their way across my desk, from trendy new beauty staples to multitasking small appliances. I took the time to return to my haul and highlight the items that made the biggest impact on me this past year. Below is a thoughtfully curated list of 16 products I'd add to my cart all over again.
16 Shopping Writer-Loved Finds From 2023 Our Place Always Pan 2.0 , $105 (was $150); fromourplace.com . Ninja 12-in-1 Smart Double Oven , $250 (was $350); amazon.com . Shinery Radiance Wash Jewelry Cleaner and Brush Duo , $45 (was $56); amazon.com . Shark FlexStyle Air Styling & Drying System , $250 (was $300); sharkclean.com . Lalais the Blotting Compact , $48; lalais.com . Urban Decay Vice Lip Bond Glossy Liquid Lipstick , $27; sephora.com . Gatherall Bra , $68; wegatherall.com . Vegamour Hydr-8 Leave-In Conditioner , $34; vegamour.com . Conair Power Steam Garment Steamer , $43; amazon.com . iWooly Cordless Vacuum Cleaner , $80 (was $150); amazon.com . Luxome Ultra Plush Throw , $135; luxome.com . Pyrex Deep Glass Baking Dish , $16; amazon.com . Journee Collection Zina Shoe , $70; journeecollection.com . Hanhoo Blemish Patch Discovery Kit , $25; amazon.com . Uniqlo HeatTech Crew Mellow Sock , $8; uniqlo.com . Innbeauty Project Slushy Serum Moisturizer , $30; innbeautyproject.com . Pyrex Deep Glass Baking Dish Amazon
Buy on Amazon $16 I bought a few of these as backups for Thanksgiving, but their deep design and snug lid made me toss my other shallow glass baking dishes. I'll make a large casserole and conveniently save the leftovers for lunch without wasting plastic wrap or tin foil. Anytime I bring it to a potluck, people always ask me where I bought it.
Journee Collection Zina Shoe Journee Collection
Buy on Journeecollection.com $70 When it comes to shoes, I like to stick to a few dependable options to get me through a season. The Zina from the Journee Collection is the perfect mix of classic Oxford style with an edgy twist because of its lug sole and fun patent leather finish. They are a surprisingly lightweight pair that require no break-in period.
Hanhoo Blemish Patch Discovery Kit Amazon
Buy on Amazon $25 I'm obsessed with hydrocolloid patches, and Hanhoo's seven-piece collection has a patch for just about every blemish situation. Whether I'm dealing with body acne, a gunk-filled T-zone, or dark spots, there is always an option to suit my needs. It's like the perfect first-aid kit for zits.
Uniqlo HeatTech Crew Mellow Sock Uniqlo
Buy on Uniqlo.com $8 My feet run cold, whether they're in shearling lined boots or a sleek pair of sneakers. I love how thin yet incredibly warm these Uniqlo socks feel. According to the brand, its proprietary HeatTech technology locks in heat while also controlling odors.
Innbeauty Project Slushy Serum Moisturizer Innbeauty Project
Buy on Innbeautyproject.com $30 It was love at first touch with the Slushy Serum Moisturizer. After hearing everyone rave about this formula, I finally decided to give it a shot, and I wasn't disappointed. The gel texture is surprisingly hydrating and boasts smoothing bakuchiol, brightening yuzu, and plumping hyaluronic acid that feels like a slushy for your face.
Our Place Always Pan 2.0 Our Place
Buy on Fromourplace.com $150 $105 In May, two other shopping writers and I tested the new Always Pan 2.0 from one of my favorite cookware brands, Our Place. I'm happy to report that it still holds up. This little guy lives on my stove and is probably the most-used piece of cooking equipment I own. The nesting spatula feature has also been a game changer.
Ninja 12-in-1 Smart Double Oven Amazon
Buy on Amazon $350 $250 I can honestly say that I can't remember the last time we used our oven thanks to this do-it-all gadget that bears the brunt of most of my lunches and dinners. I love making multiple dishes at once in this thing due to all of the cooking functions, and it's one of the easiest appliances to use—even my husband and father-in-law sing its praises whenever it's their turn to make a meal.
Shinery Radiance Wash Jewelry Cleaner and Brush Duo Amazon
Buy on Amazon $56 $45 I have to admit that I never owned a nice piece of jewelry before my engagement ring and wedding band. I couldn't believe how easy it was to get them to shine like new using this cleaner and brush kit. Anytime they start to look dull, I'll just whip this out, and they're clean in minutes with minimal effort.
Shark FlexStyle Air Styling & Drying System Shark
Buy on Sharkclean.com $300 $250 What was I even doing before the Shark FlexStyle came into my life? Whether I'm going for frizz-free curls or a voluminous blowout, I only need this tool to get it done. The new FrizzFighter Finishing Tool has helped me smooth out my tresses quickly. It's so indispensable to me that I won't travel without it—I make room in whatever luggage I'm using.
Lalais the Blotting Compact Lalais
Buy on Lalais.com $48 I discovered this generously sized blotting compact thanks to Oprah, who put it on her Favorite Things list this year. The packaging feels so luxe that I have no qualms about whipping it out in the middle of dinner to degrease my T-zone with just a couple of swift pats. This mirror is also the perfect size for on-the-go touchups.
Urban Decay Vice Lip Bond Glossy Liquid Lipstick Sephora
Buy on Sephora $27 Finally, a long-lasting lip color that doesn't make my lips feel like the Sahara desert after an hour. "Test Em" is the loveliest dusty rose shade that looks gorgeous with bold, neutral, or minimal makeup looks. However, if you're ready to get dramatic, "Once Strangers" is the it color of winter.
Gatherall Bra Gatherall
Buy on Wegatherall.com $68 If you're anything like me and absolutely detest the idea of even putting a bra on for a few hours, you need to try this Gatherall strapless bra. It's the first adhesive silicone bra I’ve tried that hasn't been overly obvious thanks to its super slim design, and it's even sweatproof. Plus, it's super easy to care for.
Vegamour Hydr-8 Leave-In Conditioner Vegamour
Buy Now $34 Since its launch earlier this year, Vegamour's silky Hydr-8 Leave-In Conditioner has had me in a serious chokehold. I've tried so many different leave-in conditioners, but I always come back to this one because it's one of the few that leave my waves silky and soft without ever weighing them down with product.
Conair Power Steam Garment Steamer Amazon
Buy on Amazon $43 Whipping out the iron and folding table is a laborious affair that I'd prefer not to do, but I also hate walking around with wrinkled clothing. This travel-friendly steamer heats up in just 35 seconds and gets the job done in no time. You can even switch between 120 and 240 voltages.
iWooly Cordless Vacuum Cleaner Amazon
Buy on Amazon $150 $80 Our first floor is covered in all tile and hardwood flooring. Combine that with our 3-year-old husky, and we've got nothing but tumbleweeds of fur—that is until we got this vacuum. Due to its lightweight and robust design, we can do swift daily sweeps to effortlessly collect all the dust and dog hair.
Luxome Ultra Plush Throw Luxome
Buy on Luxome.com $135 Apparently, I knew nothing about peak coziness until I got my hands on this ridiculously soft and cushy throw blanket. The viscose and bamboo blend feels incredible on my skin and keeps me warm on movie nights. As a matter of fact, this is one of the few items in my house that I refuse to share.
Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
